p: As of May 2020, there are no specific therapies approved for COVID-19 treatment. One strategy is to use drugs that are already approved and known to work at different stages of viral infection and against the immune response. The use of these drugs fast-tracks a treatment plan in a global pandemic situation. Two therapeutic strategies can be distinguished: agents that can target the virus, and agents that protect the host. In the former category, trials are focused on drugs that limit entry or replication (eg, Remdesivir, Lopinavir/Ritonavir, Hydroxychloroquine, IFNα, IFNβ) ( 62). For the latter, the focus is on drugs that can limit the human inflammatory response (eg, corticosteroids, Tocilizumab which is an anti-IL-6R) or boost the innate antiviral immune response (BCG vaccine, type I IFN) ( 63).
